medium_description_en: Diagnoses axial spondyloarthritis according to Assessment of Spondyloarthritis International Society (ASAS) criteria.

seo.meta_description_en: The ASAS Criteria for Axial Spondyloarthritis (SpA) diagnoses axial spondyloarthritis according to Assessment of Spondyloarthritis International Society (ASAS) criteria.
seo.keywords_en: Spondyloarthritis, spa, spondylitis, sacroiliitis, si joint

how_to_use.use_case_en: Patients with lower back pain in whom spondyloarthritis is in the differential diagnosis.

next_steps.management_en:
Strong recommendations for patients with axial SpA from the American College of Rheumatology (ACR) include:

  • Use of NSAIDs.
  • Use of TNF inhibitors if activity persists despite NSAIDs.
  • Avoid using systemic glucocorticoids.
  • Physical therapy.
  • Hip arthroplasty for patients with advanced hip arthritis.

about.formula_en:
Entry criterion:

Back pain ≥3 months and age at onset <45 years

Required criteria:

Sacroiliitis on imaging* plus ≥1 SpA feature, or

HLA-B27 plus ≥2 additional SpA features

SpA features:

  • Inflammatory back pain
  • Arthritis
  • Enthesitis (heel)
  • Uveitis
  • Dactylitis
  • Psoriasis
  • Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis
  • Good response to NSAIDs
  • Family history of SpA
  • HLA-B27
  • Elevated CRP

*Active (acute) inflammation on MRI highly suggestive of SpA-associated sacroiliitis, or definite radiographic sacroiliitis according to modified New York criteria (bilateral grade 2-4 sacroiliitis or unilateral grade 3-4 sacroiliitis, Van Der Linden 1984).

Original/Primary Reference.text: Rudwaleit M, Van Der Heijde D, Landewé R, et al. The development of Assessment of SpondyloArthritis international Society classification criteria for axial spondyloarthritis (part II): validation and final selection. Ann Rheum Dis. 2009;68(6):777-83.

Other References.text: Van Der Linden S, Valkenburg HA, Cats A. Evaluation of diagnostic criteria for ankylosing spondylitis. A proposal for modification of the New York criteria. Arthritis Rheum. 1984;27(4):361-8.

Clinical Practice Guidelines.text: Ward MM, Deodhar A, Akl EA, et al. American College of Rheumatology/Spondylitis Association of America/Spondyloarthritis Research and Treatment Network 2015 Recommendations for the Treatment of Ankylosing Spondylitis and Nonradiographic Axial Spondyloarthritis. Arthritis Rheumatol. 2016;68(2):282-98.

creator_info.about_en: Martin Rudwaleit, MD, is a rheumatologist at University Hospital Charité, Campus Benjamin Franklin, in Berlin, Germany. He is the principal coordinator of the German Spondyloarthritis Inception Cohort, a prospective longitudinal study on early spondyloarthritis. Dr. Rudwaleit's research interests include clinical aspects of ankylosing spondylitis and other spondyloarthritides.

input_schema.label_en: Back pain ≥3 months and age at onset <45 years
input_schema.name: backpain
required
input_schema.tips_en: Sacroiliitis on imaging = active (acute) inflammation on MRI highly suggestive of SpA-associated sacroiliitis, or definite radiographic sacroiliitis according to modified New York criteria

input_schema.subheading_instructions: ≥1 required if sacroiliitis on imaging; ≥2 features other than HLA-B27 if HLA-B27 positive

input_schema.name: ibp
input_schema.tips_en: At least 4/5 present: (1) age at onset <40 years, (2) insidious onset, (3) improvement with exercise, (4) no improvement with rest, (5) pain at night with improvement upon getting up

input_schema.name: arthritis
input_schema.tips_en: Past or present active synovitis (peripheral) diagnosed by a physician

input_schema.name: enthesitis
input_schema.tips_en: Past or present spontaneous pain or tenderness at Achilles insertion or plantar fascia at calcaneus

input_schema.name: uveitis
input_schema.tips_en: Past or present uveitis anterior, confirmed by an ophthalmologist

input_schema.name: dactylitis
input_schema.tips_en: Past or present, diagnosed by a physician

input_schema.name: psoriasis
input_schema.tips_en: Past or present, diagnosed by a physician

input_schema.name: nsaids
input_schema.tips_en: Resolution or improvement of back pain 24–48 hrs after full dose of NSAID

input_schema.name: famhx
input_schema.tips_en: Presence in 1st- or 2nd-degree relatives of any of the following: (1) ankylosing spondylitis, (2) psoriasis, (3) acute uveitis, (4) reactive arthritis, (5) IBD

input_schema.name: crp
input_schema.tips_en: After exclusion of other causes for elevated CRP
